definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: The crime of abusing the power and position is a superinduced crime of Criminal Law.
sentences.chinese: 滥用职权罪是《刑法》新增设的罪名。

sentences.english: Any judicial officer who abuses his power and commits the crime mentioned in the preceding paragraph shall be given a heavier punishment.
sentences.chinese: 司法工作人员滥用职权，犯前款罪的，从重处罚。

sentences.english: Naturally, this breeds corruption and abuse of power.
sentences.chinese: 自然，这孕育了腐败和滥用职权。

sentences.english: President Medvedev also called for tough punishment against officers who will abuse their position.
sentences.chinese: 梅德奥杰夫亦对滥用职权的官员予以重罚。

sentences.english: He won't abuse authority even if he become the president.
sentences.chinese: 即使他是董事长，他也不会滥用职权。

sentences.english: A new security man threw his weight about.
sentences.chinese: 一个新上任的安全官滥用职权。

sentences.english: Some government officials abuse power and make public money their own.
sentences.chinese: 一些政府官员滥用职权，公为己有。

sentences.english: from being abused by the military or by the police.
sentences.chinese: 免于军事方面或是警察的滥用职权。

sentences.english: Excited executioner exercising his excising powers excessively by examining the goods carelessly.
sentences.chinese: 兴奋的执行者滥用职权，草率检查商品。

sentences.english: Corruption and abuse of administrative power have continued to this day.
sentences.chinese: 贪污腐化和滥用职权的现象至今犹存。

sentences.english: Tom was arrested on charges of corruption and abuse of power.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆因被指控犯有贪污罪和滥用职权罪而被捕。

definition: to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty/malpractice
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
to abuse one's position for personal gain (idiom)
to exact bribes/to solicit bribes/to demand bribes/to extort
to know the law and break it (idiom); consciously going against the rules
